entry.title: SSH Connection
entry.content:
I want to connect as a particular user (let’s say remoteUser for example) to a machine using ssh without typing any passport.
I just have to :

  • copy the content of my local public key ( ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub)
  • paste it into the authorized_keys file of remoteUser (/home/remoteUser/.ssh/authorized_keys) of the remote system.

Then I can connect the remote system using :

 ssh remoteUser@remoteMachineIp
entry.summary: I want to connect as a particular user (let’s say remoteUser for example) to a machine using ssh without typing any passport. I just have to : copy the content of my local public key ( ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub) paste it into the authorized_keys file of remoteUser (/home/remoteUser/.ssh/authorized_keys) of the remote system.

entry.title: Pushing docker image to nexus OSS

link.title: Pushing docker image to nexus OSS

entry.content:
I have a local image if my software MyTool created from a dockerfile.
I want to push it into my nexus repository as the version 1.0 of MyTool.
Let’s say my nexus is available on port 7777.

I start by getting the image reference on my local system:

 docker images

then I tag my image:

 docker tag b3b8a2229953 @nexusIP:7777/mytool:1.0

and I push it to nexus:

 docker push @nexusIP:7777/mytool:1.0
entry.summary: I have a local image if my software MyTool created from a dockerfile. I want to push it into my nexus repository as the version 1.0 of MyTool. Let’s say my nexus is available on port 7777.
